io::​cmdline_arg
sp_base_object
io::​ .​cmdline_arg​#(type T=int, string FORMAT="=%d")

Command-line argument representation as an object.

Upon creation, specified constructor name argument is used to parse argv and extract information and values regarding the argument.

Basic usage is as follows:

function void foo();
    cmdline_arg#() bar;

    // Create an instance which corrosponds to +BAR command-line argument.
    bar = cmdline_arg#()::type_id::create("BAR");

    // Check whether the argument was passed to run
    // command (with or w/o specific value)
    if (bar.arg_exists())
        this.bazz();

    // Check whether a value was specified with the argument
    if (bar.value_exists()) begin
        this.foo_bar_bazz(
            bar.value()
        );
    end
endfunction: foo
methods
arg
virtual function string arg()

Get the command line argument checked against argv as a string.

arg_exists
virtual function bit arg_exists()

Returns 1 if the argument was provided via command line or 0 otherwise.

value
virtual function T value()

Get the value of the command line argument, if provided through the command line, if no value was provided, a fatal is reported.

value_exists
virtual function bit value_exists()

Returns 1 if both an argument and a value were provided through the command line, or 0 otherwise.

format
virtual function string format()

Get the format used to extract the value of the command line argument as a string.

arg_with_format
virtual function string arg_with_format()

Get the entire command line argument including the format tested against the "$value$plusarg" system task as a string.

Types
int_cmdline_arg
typedef cmdline_arg#(
int,
"=%
d"
) int_cmdline_arg

Integral command line argument class typedef.

string_cmdline_arg
typedef cmdline_arg#(
string,
"=%
s"
) string_cmdline_arg

String type command line argument typedef.
